lines.text: Heyyy!
You're dreaming about a girl you've never met?
Come on, Fonz, haven't you ever dreamed?
Hey I'm not the dreamer! I'm the dreamee!
So how did you do on that social studies test?
I missed that question on Alaska. I hear they want to make it a state now.
That'll never happen.
Richie just hasn't got the appetite that Chuck has.
Marion, Argentina hasn't got the appetite that Chuck has.
I found my thrill on Blueberry Hill.
Rich! Rich!
Come quick!
What? Is there something wrong?
It's a shark!
The Fonz...
Fonz got eaten by a shark?
He did? Who said that?
Not me! What're you talking about?
Well, you just said "The shark..."!
Nooo! Listen! The Fonz is gonna jump *over* a shark!
[repeated line]
Sit on it!

[Marion has just told off the Fonz and stormed out of the room]
I'm gonna hit her.
No, you're not gonna hit my wife.
Then I'll hit you!
You're not gonna hit my son.
Then I'll hit you!
You're not gonna hit my father either.
Well I gotta hit somebody. You know where Potsie is?
Wa! Wa! Wa!
You're such a Potsie!

[Richie is worried that he's going crazy]
Come on, Richie! You're no crazier than the rest of us! Look at Potsie. You think he's normal? And Fonzie... super-cool Fonzie. Fonzie with his "Ayyy!" I mean, that's pretty... that's really sicko when you come right down to it.
I wouldn't let him hear you say that.
You tell him I said that, and I'll deny it! Every word!
OK, Ralph - take it easy.
Now you take me - nice, normal Ralphie Malphie. I got no quirks. But I know what they're saying about me. They're saying my hair's too neat, I'm too cute, and girls crave my bod.
They're not saying that, Ralph.
Yes they are. They're also saying that I look like a movie star because my teeth are too even.
[Fonzie's feet are sore from dancing and needs to be held up]
Aaaay, I'm up and moving!
You're in La-La land, Fonz.
Let me tell ya, it's a lot of fun in La-La land!
You ain't nobody until you do what you want!
A shark? That is the *stupidest* thing I have ever heard!
Stupid, yes. Also dumb. But it is something I've gotta do.
Fonz, you're not jumping over garbage cans on a bike. You're jumping over a shark. On nothing! On a couple of little skis! One little slip and chomp! Chomp! Chomp!
Thanks a lot for your support. Look, I was challenged. I gotta jump.
Arnold, go and cook up a couple of burgers for us.
But I just cleaned the grill!
Well, good! Then maybe they'll taste better!
[Fonzie and Pinky have had a fight and are sitting at the dinner table]
Dad, uh, can you come upstairs with me for a minute?
I haven't finished my dessert yet.
Well, you can finish it upstairs, Dad.
What are you doing?
Well, we have to talk.
Talk about what?
I... I don't know... the birds and bees.
Oh, Richard, we already had that talk.

[refers to the table]
Yeah, and you didn't learn much.

[Richie tries to get Fonz to get rid of a very tall, very big lumberjack]
You picked a fight with a red and black tree?
[watching a Chicago Bears football game in 1956]
That Bears quarterback is no good. He's washed up. He's 30.
That's ridiculous. George Blanda still has a few more good years left.
Why can't you be a normal boy and swallow goldfish?
I wouldn't miss this for a weekend with the Green Bay Packers as their towel girl!
I've still got it!
Release the doves!
[to his class]
Don't you understand, your brain is clay and I gotta *squeeze* it!
[class is startled]

[then calmly]
Let me put that another way...
